docs.snippet: Facebook's latest privacy scandal, involving Trump campaign consultants who allegedly stole data on tens of millions of users in order to influence elections, has some people reconsidering their relationship status with the social network.

headline.print_headline: Breaking Up With Facebook? It's Harder Than It Looks
headline.main: Breaking Up With Facebook? It's Harder Than It Looks

docs.snippet: Germany's justice minister Katarina Barley has asked Facebook to clarify whether the personal data of the social media site's 30 million users in the country were protected from unlawful use by third parties, according to a report in the Funke gro...

headline.print_headline: Germany Summons Facebook Over User Data Safety Concerns: Report
headline.main: Germany Summons Facebook Over User Data Safety Concerns: Report

docs.snippet: U.S. stocks advanced modestly on Tuesday as higher oil prices lifted the energy sector, but another slump in Facebook Inc shares curbed gains.

headline.print_headline: Wall Street Advances on Energy Bump; Facebook Woes Continues
headline.main: Wall Street Advances on Energy Bump; Facebook Woes Continues

docs.snippet: Asian shares fell on Tuesday after investors took profits in high-flying U.S. technology shares on fears of stiffer regulation as Facebook came under fire following reports it allowed improper access to user data.

headline.print_headline: Asian Shares Fall as Facebook Data Flap Spooks Tech Stocks
headline.main: Asian Shares Fall as Facebook Data Flap Spooks Tech Stocks

docs.snippet: The dive in Facebook Inc's shares may have created a rare buying opportunity for the high-flying social media company's stock - if investors believe a growing controversy over use of personal data will not severely damage the company's financial o...

headline.print_headline: Facebook Data Controversy Drives Stock to Cheap Levels
headline.main: Facebook Data Controversy Drives Stock to Cheap Levels

docs.snippet: Asian shares slumped Tuesday, as pessimism followed an overnight drop in New York amid a rout in technology companies.

headline.print_headline: Asian Shares Slump After US Technology Drop on Facebook News
headline.main: Asian Shares Slump After US Technology Drop on Facebook News

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it would end its partnerships with several large data brokers who help advertisers target people on the social network, a step that follows a scandal over how Facebook handles personal information.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Cuts Ties to Data Brokers in Blow to Targeted Ads
headline.main: Facebook Cuts Ties to Data Brokers in Blow to Targeted Ads

docs.snippet: A U.S. judge has ordered Facebook Inc to let her review documents it has refused to give the Internal Revenue Service as that agency probes whether the social media company used an Irish unit to slash billions of dollars from its tax bill.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Must Give Judge Documents for U.S. Tax Probe of Irish Unit
headline.main: Facebook Must Give Judge Documents for U.S. Tax Probe of Irish Unit

docs.snippet: The U.S. Senate Judiciary Committee said on Monday it had invited the chief executive officers of Facebook Inc, Alphabet Inc and Twitter Inc to testify at an April 10 hearing on data privacy.

headline.print_headline: Facebook CEO Among Those Invited to Testify at U.S. Senate Hearing
headline.main: Facebook CEO Among Those Invited to Testify at U.S. Senate Hearing
